description: Review your knowledge by answering these questions.
title: Review

quizContent.question:
What gets printed when the following code executes? 
 
    var a;
    console.log(typeof a);
The below code needs to check if the two values are equal in the if condition, and print to console only if they are. Fill in the missing code.
quizContent.code:
var a = 20;
var b = 20;
if (a  b) {
    console.log("Variables are equal");
}

lessons.title: Variable Declaration
lessons.description: Learn how variables are created in JavaScript.

lessons.title: Number Primitive Type
lessons.description: We'll look at the number primitive type in JavaScript.

lessons.title: String and Boolean
lessons.description: Leran how the string and boolean primitive types can be created and used in JavaScript.

lessons.title: Understanding undefined
lessons.description: In this video, we'll learn about a unique primitive type in JavaScript called undefined.

lessons.title: Understanding null
lessons.description: In this video, we'll learn about another unique primitive type in JavaScript called null.

lessons.title: Difference between undefined and null
lessons.description: A commonly asked question is how to differentiate between undefined and null. When to use what? We'll cover this difference in this tutorial.

lessons.title: Types summary
lessons.description: Let's summarize what we've learnt about the type system so far.

lessons.title: Review
lessons.description: Review your knowledge of the JavaScript type system by answering these questions

lessons.title: The typeof operator
lessons.description: Learn how to use the typeof operator to identify the type of a value assigned to a variable.

lessons.title: Type Coercion and the === operator
lessons.description: Learn about how JavaScript sometimes converts types automatically. Also learn how to compare values for equality using the === operator.

lessons.title: Type Coercion Summary
lessons.description: Let's summarize what we've learnt about type coercion and the equality operator.
